alert.note: Alert for Coos; Curry; Douglas; Josephine (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 01 at 10:11AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...Flood Potential Outlook for Coos, Curry, Douglas, and Josephine Counties.... Quick rises and a slight potential for flooding on area streams, creeks, and rivers due to the combination of heavy rainfall and snow melt in the following counties in Oregon... Coos, Curry, Douglas, and Josephine. A series of fronts is likely to bring periods of moderate to heavy precipitation totaling 2 to 6 inches of water over much of southwestern Oregon Sunday night, January 2nd into Wednesday, January 5th. Much of this precipitation is likely to fall as rain Tuesday into Wednesday as snow levels rise into the 6000 to 7000 foot range. Currently, Deer Creek near Roseburg, the South Fork of the Coquille River at both Myrtle Point and Powers, and the Coquille River at Coquille are forecast to reach action stage, but are not forecast to reach flood stage during the Monday to Wednesday time period. Other streams, creeks, and rivers across the area are likely to rise significantly during the above mentioned time period and it is still within the realm of possibility that flooding could occur. A flood potential outlook is issued when there is the potential for significant rises or flooding along rivers and streams. This product will be updated as necessary. Watches and warnings may be issued by the National Weather Service if it is deemed necessary.
